column1: 6A819ACE-88DA-435B-A50A-1F1DC4EDC618#appfire#F9D42A32-01F5-439E-8EE3-C3023F5740E3#appfire#alarm.queue#appfire#0#appfire#Logging Framework is Asynchronous in nature. Log Events goes to the Queue first and connectors takes the event from the queue for processing. Event Queue Type 0 - Circular Queue (RECOMMENDED) 1 - Infinite Queue with Initial Capacity and events will be wrapped in Soft References (JVM will garbage collect these soft references when it runs out of memory). 2 - Infinite Queue (NOT RECOMMENDED)#appfire#Alarm Queue Type#appfire#1#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-03-04 10:10:14.0#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-03-04 10:10:14.0#appfire#1#appfirenewline#7F909800-CBAB-4D37-8F90-28845CAD4DDA#appfire#F9D42A32-01F5-439E-8EE3-C3023F5740E3#appfire#refresh.frequency#appfire#0#appfire#Refresh Time to reload this configuration file In a production environment
column2: if you want to debug a specific component you can change the Alarm Log Levels (for specific Target like File
column3: DB etc) of that specific components. Once the configuration is refreshed new Log Events will be written to the configured Target (File
column4: DB etc). This will help to isolate and troubleshoot a production environment without shutting down the application. #appfire#Refresh Frequency#appfire#1#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-03-04 10:10:14.0#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-03-04 10:10:14.0#appfire#1#appfirenewline#A85CF10D-9986-4687-BA83-F099FD5812B4#appfire#F9D42A32-01F5-439E-8EE3-C3023F5740E3#appfire#alarm.volume#appfire#100000#appfire##appfire#Alarm Volume#appfire#1#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-03-04 10:10:14.0#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-03-04 10:10:14.0#appfire#1
